Welcome to flight_software’s documentation!¶

class flight_software.flightcontroller.FlightController(port='/dev/ttyS0', baudrate=115200, timeout=1)¶

Representation of the flight controller.

connection¶

The serial connection to the flight controller. None until initialized.

Type

serial.Serial

port¶

The port of the serial conection.

Type

string

baudrate¶

The baudrate of the serial connection.

Type

int

timeout¶

The maximum alowable time in seconds to wait for a message.

Type

int

position¶

The current position of the drone relative to the start position (or to the last zeroed postion).

Type

(float, float, float)

armed¶

The arm status of the flight controller.

Type

bool

thrust¶

The current value of the thrust signal being sent to the drone. In range (0, 100)

Type

float

pitch¶

The current value of the pitch signal being sent to the drone. In range (-100, 100)

Type

float

roll¶

The current value of the roll signal being sent to the drone. In range (-100, 100)

Type

float

yaw¶

The current value of the yaw signal being sent to the drone. In range (-100, 100)

Type

float

commands(channels)¶

This function takes a list of values of max length 14 and sends it in the correct form to the flight controller. Gives the neutral value of 0x05DC (1500) to the unused channels.

connect()¶

Connect to the flight controller, and start signal loop thread.

Raises

SerialException – Raised when the connection fails

disconnect()¶

Disconnect from the flight controller and end signal loop thread.

dronecontrol(pitch, throttle, yaw)¶

Master function which will let you asign the roll, pitch, throttle and yaw values.
